intro: Sticherus hirtus var. paleaceus, commonly known as the paleaceus sticherus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are typically slender and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitat.
